Evaluation.explanation: The candidate demonstrates a good grasp of several programming languages, including Python, Java, C/C++, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Dart, and Kotlin. They also list familiarity with relevant technologies and frameworks such as GitHub, Nodejs, Bootstrap, SpringBoot, MongoDB, Docker, and React Native. The candidate appears proficient in a variety of tools and languages. The resume provides a solid foundation for building, maintaining, and improving software systems.

The candidate showcases problem-solving skills through project descriptions. For example, the Advertisement Management Website project involves roles with different permissions and report handling. The Chat Application project details database design and real-time chat implementation. Medical Booking Website shows FE and BE development experiences. These experiences show the candidate's ability to analyze requirements and implement solutions. More details during the technical interview would solidify this assessment.

The resume mentions responsibilities within projects, such as 'Designing UI using Figma, front-end and back-end side implementing, testing' and 'Product owner, FE + BE developer, architecture designer.' These roles imply collaboration and communication within a team setting. The extracurricular activities, such as GDSC Hackathon and Thach Thuc’s organization board, further demonstrate teamwork abilities. Details on communication style and team dynamics would be beneficial.

The candidate's projects indicate relevant experience in web application development using various technologies. The projects are recent (2023-2024). The candidate displays the capability to learn new technologies. The projects undertaken are solid and give evidence of relevant adaptability.

The resume mentions 'testing' as a responsibility in the Advertisement Management Website project. While the Github repositories are provided, there's no explicit mention of specific testing methodologies or code quality practices (e.g., unit tests, code reviews). More information is needed to accurately assess this area. Accessing provided GitHub repositories may improve the score.

The candidate mentions 'architecture designer' in the Medical Booking Website project. The descriptions of the projects provides a rudimentary understanding of the design of System. Without detailed descriptions of system architecture it is difficult to provide accurate score.

The resume shows the candidate has worked with multiple frameworks. The candidate has demonstrated experience with adopting new technologies in past projects. The variety of the frameworks used indicates this ability. The GDSC Hackathon participation also suggests a willingness to explore new technologies.

The project descriptions suggest collaborative efforts, and the extracurricular activities (GDSC Hackathon, Thach Thuc’s organization board) further support teamwork skills. The candidate has experience in collaborative settings. More details on specific teamwork skills are required.
